column2: VIRGINIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Virginia
column6: VA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column6: You may proceed only if the way is clear

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic increases ahead
column6: Winding road ahead

column2: 3. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 4. This road sign indicates:
column4: The maximum safe speed for an expressway exit.
column6: The speed limit in a work zone.
column8: The maximum safe speed for an expressway entrance.
column10: The speed limit in a residential area.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Natural reserve ahead
column6: Zoo ahead

column2: 6. What does this sign indicate?
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Work zone ahead
column6: A steep grade is ahead

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Lanes are reserved for vehicles with the indicated number of occupants in vehicle
column6: No parking
column8: Parking is not allowed during the indicated hours.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: The road ends ahead
column6: “Y” intersection ahead
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 10. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 11. U-turns in business districts are:
column4: always illegal.
column6: legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.
column8: legal only at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

column2: 12. Before changing lanes:
column4: check for other drivers who may be moving into the same lane as you.
column6: check your side and rearview mirrors.

column2: 13. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 14. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the steering ability.
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 15. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column8: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 16. High occupancy vehicles (HOV) lanes are reserved for all of the following, except:
column4: carpools.
column6: tractor trailers.

column2: 17. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.

column2: 18. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 19. When parking next to a curb, you may not park more than:
column4: six inches from the curb.
column6: 1 foot from the curb.

column2: 20. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: get back into the vehicle.
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 21. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 22. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 23. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 24. When entering a street or crossing over a sidewalk from a driveway, drivers are not required to stop.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 25. Bicycles:
column4: do not have the same rights as motorized vehicles.
column6: required to stay on the curb.
column8: are required to stay on bicycle paths.
column10: are considered vehicles and have the same rights as motorized vehicles.

column2: 26. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 27. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 28. If your vehicle is equipped with airbags, you should:
column4:
move your seat back so that you are at least ten inches
from the steering wheel.
column6: always buckle up.
column8: if your steering wheel is adjustable, tilt it downward to point the air bag toward your chest.

column2: 29. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: Never.
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 30. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 31. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 32. Motorists are required to use headlights:
column4: whenever you use your windshield wipers as a result of bad weather.
column6: at sunset, as soon as light begins to fade.
column8: during inclement weather such as rain or fog, when visibility is reduced to 500 feet.

column2: 33. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Flashing red light
column6: Stop sign

column2: 34. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to turn on your headlights.
column6: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column10: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 35. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the right.
column6: pedestrians only.

column2: 36. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: yellow warning lights.
column6: red warning lights.

column2: 37. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 38. For your own protection, never:
column4: allow an unlicensed driver to drive your vehicle.
column6: use a suspended drivers license.

column2: 39. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it stops raining.
column6: on hills.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 40. Your license will be revoked or suspended if you are convicted of:
column4: making a false statement to DMV.
column6: eluding police.
column8: driving while under the influence of alcohol or drugs (DUI).
